title: UK chemical producer Alent’s shareholders approve Platform’s $2.1bn offer
text:
UK chemical producer Alent’s shareholders approve Platform’s $2.1bn offer 10 September 2015 Print Email 
UK-listed speciality chemicals producer Alent's shareholders have approved Platform Specialty Products' $2.1bn offer to acquire the company. 
The shareholders voted in favour of the deal during a general meeting. Platform Specialty Products submitted its bid for Alent in July. 
Alent supplies speciality chemicals and engineered materials for electronics, automotive and industrial applications. It operates two business segments, including Enthone and Alpha. 
Enthone offers electroplating chemistry to electronics, automotive and industrial markets, while Alpha is an assembly materials business that supplies interconnected materials, primarily for electronics applications. 
In 2014, Alent generated revenues of £413m, with adjusted profit before tax of £91.5m. "Platform has received a notice of early termination of the antitrust waiting period under the US Hart-Scott Rodino act, and approval from South Korean authorities." 
So far, Platform has received a notice of early termination of the antitrust waiting period under the US Hart-Scott Rodino act, and approval from South Korean authorities. 
Subject to certain other closing conditions and approvals, the transaction is expected to conclude by early 2016. 
Following the deal, Platform will continue to trade on the New York Stock Exchange as a US domiciled company. 
Platform founder and chairman Martin Franklin earlier said: "The proposed acquisition of Alent marks a further step in the Platform strategy of building a portfolio of best-in-class 'Asset-Lite, High-Touch' businesses in the specialty chemicals industry." 
The company expects the combined business to generate $50m in annual pre-tax cost savings. Follow Us:
